alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Mainly minor flooding will continue for flood-prone areas adjacent to the Hackensack River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM EDT, The Hackensack River at Rivervale continues to report flooding. Water levels are decreasing but may take until early this evening to drop below flood stage. - No additional rainfall is expected which will allow the river to slowly recede. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
